oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Use of neurostimulation to localize and anesthetize the brachial plexus of calves undergoing metacarpal surgery
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Lardé, H.
Nichols, S.
Desrochers, A.
Bussières, G.
Kopal, M.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: surgery
locoregional block
general anesthesia
brachial plexus
orthopedic surgery
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: In cattle, locoregional anesthesia is usually effective for surgery distal to the metacarpophalangealjoint. However, for proximal interventions, general anesthesia is often required. The aim of this study was to assess the usefulness of brachial plexus anesthesia for orthopedic surgery in calves. We hypothesized that this locoregional block, combined with sedation, would be sufficient for interventions on the metacarpal bones in calves.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 2012; 212-213
